channel.title: Posts on Wang's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Wang's Blog

item.title: Modeling Protein Structures
item.description: Introduction There are many works for protein modeling regarding proteins as a 1-d sequences. From this perspective, proteins resembles natural languages - amino acides are the language tokens. One huge advantage of such approach is that it enables the easy utilization of the rich existing works for natural language modeling where great success has been achieved in recent years However, proteins have four levels of structure that is essential for their function.

item.title: Bio-101 for AI Community
item.description: Amino acids and proteins The basic molecule units of proteins are amino acids. A amino acid consists of three major groups: amino ($-\text{NH}_3^+)$, carboxylic acid ($-\text{CO}_2{\text H}$) and a side chain ($\text{R}$). The carbon that attaches amino group is called alpha carbon. The following figure illustrates the simple structure of an amino acid. The general structure of amino acid that consists of three groups: amino, carboxylic acid and side chain
